intro: Aporosa bulusanensis, commonly known as the Bulusan mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
